snippet: The post-holiday lull in new record releases is over and as seven new albums showed up in the top 10, Billboard reported.
abstract: The post-holiday lull in new record releases is over and as seven new albums showed up in the top 10, Billboard reported.
lead_paragraph: The postholiday lull in new record releases is over, and as new recordings flood the market seven new albums showed up in the Top 10 of the Billboard 200 chart this week, led by Tim McGraw's "Emotional Traffic," which sold 68,000 copies and landed in the No. 2 slot, Billboard reported.

headline.main: Shakeup in Top 10, but Adele Still No. 1
